prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime. [caption] At the juncture of the corridor, to the north is a dead end with a phone. To the south is the foyer. To the east is the corridor that leads to the Fox Chamber. There is an airduct connecting that corridor to the Fox Chamber.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Apollo:
A key? So, then, the Fox Chamber was locked?
Fulbright:
Yes
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Tenma Taro's really that little maid gal. Ain't no doubt about it!
Person: Filch
Testimony 1
Testimony: I mean, the Tenma Taro I saw was just a lil' thing 'bout her size!
Person: Filch
Testimony 2
Testimony: But the little runt had a big ol' staff. I seen it when she came into the foyer!
Person: Filch
Testimony 3
Testimony: Betcha she stole it from the Forbidden Chamber after stumbling on the crime scene.
Person: Filch
Testimony 4
Testimony: She was gonna use it to wallop me on account o' my fierce reputation, I just know it!
Person: Filch

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the testimonies and the evidence provided.

First, the testimonies are all from L'Belle. Let's look at each one. Testimony 0 says he was hiding in the shadows in the hallway when he heard a confession. Testimony 1 mentions Jinxie fleeing after learning of her father's crime. Testimony 2 says the mayor woke up, stood up, and opened the Forbidden Chamber. Testimony 3 claims that as he ran in terror, the demon emerged from his prison. Testimony 4 states he fled down the hallway to the right, the one with the phone at the end.

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 17 is the Forbidden Chamber Key, which the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. The key is unique. The autopsy report (Evidence 14) says Kyubi was stabbed around 3:20 PM and was in a drug-induced slumber. Then there's the Fox and Demon Statue (Evidence 7), which was the weapon used to bludgeon the mayor, with his blood on it but no fingerprints. Also, the Crime Scene Diagram (Evidence 5) mentions the corridor layout: north dead end with a phone, south to foyer, east to Fox Chamber, with an airduct connecting to the Fox Chamber.

Testimony 4 says L'Belle fled down the hallway with the phone at the end. According to the Crime Scene Diagram, that's the north corridor. But the diagram says the north corridor is a dead end with a phone. If he fled there, he would be trapped. However, the Fox Chamber is to the east, connected via an airduct. Wait, maybe there's a contradiction here. Let me check the evidence again.

Also, the Fox Chamber's Crime Photo (Evidence 9) has bloody footprints and black feathers. The Golden Fur (Evidence 8) found at the scene might relate to the Nine-Tails costume. The Amazing Nine-Tails Mask (Evidence 10) has white hair inside, which could be from Rex Kyubi since he had snow-white hair (Character 4).

Wait, L'Belle's Testimony 2 says the mayor opened the Forbidden Chamber after waking up. But the key (Evidence 17) was swallowed by the mayor. So if the mayor swallowed the key, how could he open the Forbidden Chamber right after waking up? Unless he had the key before swallowing it. Wait, maybe the key was taken from the killer. So the mayor took the key from the killer, swallowed it. Then if he opened the Forbidden Chamber, he would have needed the key. But if he had swallowed it, maybe he couldn't have opened it immediately. That could be a contradiction. Let me check the testimony again.

Testimony 2: "Immediately AFTER that, the mayor came to, stood up and opened the Forbidden Chamber!" But if the mayor swallowed the key (Evidence 17), he wouldn't have the key to open the chamber right after waking up. Unless he had already opened it before swallowing the key. So this testimony might contradict Evidence 17. The key was swallowed by the mayor, so he couldn't have opened the chamber after regaining consciousness unless he had the key in his possession. But the key was taken from the killer and swallowed, so the mayor shouldn't have had access to it after that. Therefore, Testimony 2 says the mayor opened the chamber after coming to, but according to Evidence 17, the key was inside him. Therefore, the mayor couldn't have opened the chamber after swallowing the key. So that's a contradiction between Testimony 2 and Evidence 17.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 4 says L'Belle fled to the hallway with the phone (north corridor, a dead end). But if he was in a dead end, how did he escape? Unless he used the phone or there's another exit. But according to the diagram, it's a dead end. However, there's an airduct connecting the east corridor to the Fox Chamber. But the north corridor's dead end doesn't have an airduct mentioned. So maybe he couldn't have fled that way and escaped. But the testimony says he did. However, maybe that's possible if he hid there and wasn't seen. Not sure.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3: L'Belle says the demon emerged from his prison as he ran in terror. But the Yokai Legend Scroll (Evidence 1) shows the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. Jinxie's Statement (Evidence 12) says the demon fled toward the foyer. The Crime Scene Diagram (Evidence 5) shows that the Fox Chamber is to the east. If the demon emerged from the prison (maybe the Forbidden Chamber?), but the key was swallowed by the mayor. So if the Forbidden Chamber was locked and the key was inside the mayor, then the demon couldn't have come out. Unless the chamber was already opened. Hmm, maybe that's another angle.

Wait, but the main contradiction I found earlier is between Testimony 2 (mayor opened the Forbidden Chamber after waking up) and Evidence 17 (key was swallowed by mayor, implying he couldn't open it after that). So the mayor couldn't open the chamber if he had already swallowed the key. Therefore, Testimony 2 is contradicted by Evidence 17.

{"evidence": 17, "testimony": 2}

response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of L'Belle's testimonies. Let's start by reviewing the testimonies given by L'Belle.

Looking at Testimony 0: He says he entered the Fox Chamber after the murder. Testimony 1 adds that he didn't enter until after Jinxie heard the confession and left. Testimony 2 mentions he heard the mayor groan and hid behind a folding screen. Testimony 3 is about seeing something horrifying up close. Testimony 4 states that the yokai feathers and tracks weren't there before the chamber was opened. Testimony 5 says the Forbidden Chamber was shut until the mayor opened it. Testimony 6 talks about a fallen statue being a token for the merger. Testimony 7 claims he was there but just watching from behind the screen.

Now, let's look at the evidence. Evidence 19 is the Hand Cream found in the Forbidden Chamber with L'Belle's logo. If L'Belle claims he was only in the Fox Chamber after the murder (Testimony 0 and 1) and that the Forbidden Chamber was shut tight until the mayor opened it (Testimony 5), how did his hand cream end up there? The Forbidden Chamber was supposed to be closed, so unless he entered it, which he didn't mention. His testimony says he was in the Fox Chamber, but the hand cream is in the Forbidden Chamber. That contradicts because he must have been in the Forbidden Chamber to leave the cream, but he claims he wasn't there. 

Wait, Testimony 5 says the Forbidden Chamber was shut until the mayor opened it. If the mayor opened it, then someone else could have entered. But if L'Belle left the hand cream there, he would have had to enter the Forbidden Chamber. But according to his testimonies, he was in the Fox Chamber. So if the hand cream (Evidence 19) is in the Forbidden Chamber, that suggests he was there, which contradicts his statements about being in the Fox Chamber and the Forbidden Chamber being closed until the mayor opened it. 

Wait, but Testimony 5 says the Forbidden Chamber was shut tight until the mayor opened it. The mayor had the key (Evidence 17, which he swallowed), so unless the killer had the key before. But the hand cream found there is L'Belle's, which implies he was inside the Forbidden Chamber. But according to L'Belle's Testimony 5, the chamber was closed until the mayor opened it. If the mayor opened it, then maybe after that someone could enter. But if L'Belle was only in the Fox Chamber (Testimony 0 and 1), how did his hand cream get into the Forbidden Chamber? Unless he entered the Forbidden Chamber after the mayor opened it. But according to his testimony, he didn't mention going into the Forbidden Chamber. So this would be a contradiction between his testimony (Testimony 5 or others) and Evidence 19.

Wait, Testimony 5 is about the Forbidden Chamber being shut until the mayor opened it. If the mayor opened it, then the chamber was opened, but L'Belle's hand cream was found inside. But L'Belle's testimonies don't mention entering the Forbidden Chamber. So the presence of his hand cream there contradicts his claim that he was only in the Fox Chamber. Therefore, the hand cream (Evidence 19) contradicts his Testimony 0 or 5. Wait, Testimony 5 says the chamber was shut until the mayor opened it. If the mayor opened it, then someone could enter. But L'Belle's testimony says he was in the Fox Chamber, not the Forbidden. So the hand cream being in the Forbidden Chamber suggests he was there, which contradicts his testimony that he didn't go there. Therefore, the evidence 19 (Hand Cream) contradicts Testimony 5? Or perhaps Testimony 0 where he claims he entered the Fox Chamber, but the hand cream is in Forbidden Chamber.

Alternatively, Testimony 5 says the Forbidden Chamber was shut until the mayor opened it. If the mayor opened it, then the chamber was opened, but L'Belle's hand cream was found there. If L'Belle left the cream there, he must have entered after the mayor opened it. But according to his testimonies, he didn't mention entering the Forbidden Chamber. So this contradiction would be between Evidence 19 and Testimony 5. Wait, Testimony 5 states that the Forbidden Chamber was shut until the mayor opened it, but if L'Belle's hand cream is in there, he must have had access after it was opened. But his testimonies don't mention going into the Forbidden Chamber. Therefore, the presence of his hand cream there suggests he was in the Forbidden Chamber, which contradicts his testimonies about his whereabouts. So the contradiction is between Evidence 19 (Hand Cream in Forbidden Chamber) and L'Belle's Testimony 5 (Forbidden Chamber was shut until mayor opened it) but how does that directly contradict? Wait, maybe if the hand cream was found in the Forbidden Chamber, which was only opened by the mayor, then L'Belle must have entered after the mayor opened it, but he didn't mention that. His testimonies focus on being in the Fox Chamber. So the contradiction is between Evidence 19 and his claim that he wasn't in the Forbidden Chamber. Which testimony specifically? Let's check his testimonies again.

Testimony 0: He entered Fox Chamber after the murder. Testimony 1: He didn't enter until after Jinxie left. Testimony 2: He heard the mayor groan and hid behind the screen (in Fox Chamber).
